item.title: Soho Club
item.body: One of the great nightlife venues with an interesting selection of music. Open from Thursday to Saturday

item.title: Le Cactus
item.body: A club where you can dance to loud, psychedelic music in a neon ambience!

item.title: Fuse
item.body: (Techno / House) (gay on some Fridays : www.lademence.com) - Because it's one of the city's techno temples and the biggest names in the field (without exception) have DJ's there, le Fuse is a must for any decent, self-respecting clubber. The unique atmosphere that prevails there attracts those in the know, who come from far and wide. The end-of-the-night crescendos, as things approach hysteria, have become the stuff of near legend. There are also gay evenings on Sundays, as fiendishly good as they are famous on our continent. Supervised free car park and democratic admission fee before midnight. Open from 10 p.m.

item.title: Louise Gallery
item.body: (R'n'b / Funk) - Louise Gallery is a bit like an MTV clip. A pinch of jet set, a dash of fashion victims and, to top it all off, an ambience as sexy and glamorous as you could wish for. Sundays are turned into gay mania by "Strong" evenings, famous for their somewhat torrid tone. The rather remarkable venue is right in the middle of the Louise district - where else? Just don't arrive in a 2CV. Open Friday to Sunday from 10 p.m.
item.address: Niveau -1 des Galeries Louise / Souterrain van de Louizagalerij

item.title: Libertine Supersport
item.body:
Doors: 23h.
Entrance is only 5€ before 0h, 1 drink included,
10€ after 0h. (Except on huge events).
Doors close at 4h, the club is quiet at 6h.

item.title: Duke's
item.body:
Exciting Cosmopolitan Night Club for Active and Trendy People... Dress code: friendly formal & casual chic
Open Thursday to Saturday from 23h00 & Sunday (Gay) from 23h30

item.title: Les Jeux d'Hiver
item.body: Ever-popular "yuppy" Brussels night-club, the car park is full of convertibles and inside the "Games" attracts girls from a good background and playboys with their Rolex watches. Open Thursday to Saturday night
item.address: Bois de la Cambre - chemin du Croquet / Ter Kamerenbos - Croquetweg

item.title: Nostalgia Club
item.body: The great hits of the 1960s and 1970s - Ties are worn. Open only in the evening

item.title: Anarchic
item.body: Anarchic, the most prestigious party in Brussels has now reached an incredible success since the beginning of the season, by charming more and more stylish addicts and making a strict selection of Belgian and International guests like Dj Deep, The Glimmers, Cosy Mozzy, Rory Philips DON'T FORGET 'BE CHIC BUT ANARCHIC' Every 3rd Friday of the month.

item.title: Studio 44
item.body: (R'n'b /Soul) - This is the new R'n'b sensation that's getting the upper part of the city going. With a slightly show-off public and a low-key setting, Thursdays here are dedicated to Stardust evenings, which are free by the way. Sundays stake their claim as the best of groove times with Funky Fever evenings. On the turntables, you come across Belgian stars such as the unstoppable Daddy-k. Open Thursday to Sunday evening from 10.30 p.m.
item.address: av. de la Toison d'Or 44 Guldenvlieslaan

item.title: The Marquee
item.body: A little disco-bar (400 people even so) in the heart of the Sablon district, frequented by a youth as smart and stylish as you could wish to see. You see some good DJs there too and, when they're in the mood, VIPs. A number of parties are held there at the end of the week. Open from 10 p.m. every Friday and Saturday

item.title: Le You
item.body: (House / Funk / R'n'b) (gay Sundays) - Le You - it's a psychedelic design on a fuchsia towelling background, it's a house or funky landmark for gorgeous girls. It's also a cosy setting where electro and gay Sundays have successfully established themselves. The indefatigable Olivier Gosseries is the man behind the record deck, a key figure of 'bruxellois' nightlife. Open from Thursday to Sunday

item.title: Bazaar
item.body: Le Bazaar is situated right in the heart of Les Marolles. A big hot-air balloon above the bar and copious quantities of candles feature in a decor reminiscent of the tales from a thousand and one nights. This is where lovers come for a bite to eat or a drink. In the basement, you dance until the small hours beneath the vaulted ceiling amidst a flashy new decor and barmaids ready to serve you some bracing Gin Fizzes. Open 7.30 p.m. to midnight; WE 'til 4 a.m.

item.title: Recyclart
item.body: Specialised electro and underground ambience in this railway station converted into a crazy cultural venue. Open : see website

item.title: Fiesta Club
item.body:
(Not available)
 
Situé dans le centre de Bruxelles, il va s’en dire que le Fiesta Club s’est construit une notoriété en moins d’un an et est aujourd’hui considéré comme un établissement VIP de première classe en Belgique.
Cette discothèque a connu un succès éclatant en s’octroyant le privilège de limiter son ouverture uniquement le vendredi et samedi.
Beaucoup s’accordent à dire, autant les clients que les professionnels du métier, que le niveau est équivalent à celui du VIP ROOM, célèbre franchise d’élite en France fréquentée par la Jet Set internationale.
Plusieurs stars mondiales sont venues le temps d’un soir. Que ce soit du monde de la musique  (50 Cent, Snoop Dogg , Alicia Keys, Ne-Yo, Kelly Rowland) , du cinéma et/ou la télévision (Adam Rodriguez des ’Experts de Miami’ et Arthur, le présentateur vedette de TF1) du sport (Didier Drogba, Franck Ribery) mais aussi de " bons belges " (Jean Claude Van Damme, Vincent Kompany, Mbark Boussoufa et Stromae).
 
Heures d'ouverture: vendredi,samedi et veille de jours fériée 22h à 06h
Tenu correct exigée
Parking surveillé

item.title: The Wood
item.body:
The Wood opened in the heart of the heritage site of the Bois de la Cambre in one of the oldest buildings in the park dating back to 1880.

After a complete renovation of the place, Carl De Moncharline and Serge Vanderheyden have entrusted the interior design to several talented artists.
 
The bar offers a magnificent terrace in the heart of the wood. It welcomes you from Wednesday to Saturday, programming the best DJs to be today's reference for Brussels nightlife.

item.title: La Demence
item.body:
(Techno / House) (gay on some Fridays : www.lademence.com) - Because it's one of the city's techno temples and the biggest names in the field (without exception) have DJ's there, le Fuse is a must for any decent, self-respecting clubber. The unique atmosphere that prevails there attracts those in the know, who come from far and wide. The end-of-the-night crescendos, as things approach hysteria, have become the stuff of near legend. There are also gay evenings on Sundays, as fiendishly good as they are famous on our continent. Supervised free car park and democratic admission fee before midnight. Open from 10 p.m.

Doors: 22:00 > 07:00

 
DJs
 
Level 1:
22h00 - 00h30 : Jonny Marsh (UK)
00h30 - 03h00 : Oliver M (UK)
03h00 - 05h30 : Steven Redant (ES)
05h30 - 08h00 : Jon Doe (DE)
 
Level 2:
00h00 - 03h30 : Dikky Vendetta (NL)
03h30 - 07h00 : Elias (ES)
07h00 - 11h30 : Chris Bekker (DE)
 
Level 3: Kennith (BE)
 
Dancers by Beyond (London)
 
VJs AlexEtJeremy (NL)
 
Entrance
15 euro before 23h; 20 euro afterwards
(10 and 15 euro when younger than 26 years)

item.title: K-nal
item.body: Contemporary atmosphere with view on the Canal and urban landscape of northern Brussels. Nowadays one the most popular clubs of Brussels, a dream for lovers of minimal electronic music.

item.title: Spirito Martini
item.body: A cult venue of the capital outside the walls of an ancient Anglican church: event hall, bar boudoir, musical quitessence, taste bud delight and a breathe taking décor!

item.title: CatClub : Black out
item.body:
When the Catclub, Brussels' eminent house night, decides to step out of its cat basket, letting loose and living large, you have Black Out, a new night of intimacy that blends old school house with italo-disco and new wave.
 

A night that embraces kitsch with no holds barred.
 
A night that promises to be hot hot hot.
 
 
Think early 90s, neon lights and acid love.
 
Think sexy-sweaty dance dance dancing.
 

Imagine a pounding sound at the door, runway lights on the ramp to the box office and inside, dancers to die for.
 
 

Decidedly more eclectic and daring (think of Black Out as the Catclub's darker little sister), the hetero-friendly night takes up residency in Tour & Taxis' La Fabbrica.
 
 
For its first edition on September 17, Black Out invites Permanent Vacation's Wolfram the Andy Warhol of today's electronic scene, finding beauty where others see trash.
 
 

Fear not though, the Catclub lives on and will continue to bring house music's top brass to the city, but for those in need of something slightly wilder, soaked in a no limits attitude, Black Out promises to bring a touch of carefree fun to Brussels' nightscape.
